question.body: What does p represent in the hypothesis?

multiple_choice.choice: Of all U.S. undergraduates, the proportion attending community college
Of all U.S. undergraduates, the proportion attending community college in 2008
Of all U.S. undergraduates, the proportion attending community college in 2010
Of 500 U.S. undergraduates, the proportion attending community college in 2010

response.feedback: Incorrect. It is true that in this scenario we are making a hypothesis about the proportion of U.S. undergrads who are attending community college, but we are making this hypothesis about a specific year.
Incorrect. We do not need to make a hypothesis about the proportion of U.S. undergrads attending community college in 2008. We already know it is 46%. Try again.

Incorrect. We will never make a hypothesis about a sample proportion, because we can always calculate it. In this scenario, the sample proportion is given. Of the 500 U.S. undergrads sampled in 2010, 52% attend community college. Try again.
